lexUnit.name: sash.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long strip or loop of cloth worn over one shoulder or round the waist.

sentence.text: The Drill Sergeant stayed firmly on his reliable duck board and puffed out a chest with red sash across khaki tunic .
The Assassin was stowing her Jokaero weapons away inside her sash .
They unwound his sash and stripped away his sodden garments .
His blue sash marked him as a Hearthware , and his face was red with heat and wine .
Bragad 's men in their red sashes set hands on sword hilts .
Then she pulled off her maroon-silk dressing gown sash and swiftly tied his right arm to the headboard .
` Have you got the yellow reflector sash ? "

The ultimate goal is to be skilled enough in kung fu to pass the grading examination for the coveted black sash of a master .

I put my hair up , belt my waist with a red suede sash from Los Angeles and pencil my lips a deep red .
